Class Connectivity_

java.lang.Object
  Connectivity_
All Implemented Interfaces:
ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter
public class Connectivity_
extends java.lang.Object
implements ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter

Connectivity_

Calculate the Euler characteristic (χ) and connectivity index (β1) of a trabecular bone network. The connectivity index can be thought of as "trabecular number".

  1. Purify stack to contain only 1 connected bone phase and 1 connected marrow phase (Purify_ plugin)
  2. Iterate through stack, calculating Euler characteristic for each bone voxel (δχ) and summing to give an Euler characteristic for bone (χ)
  3. Calculate connectivity as β1 = 1 - χ
  4. Calculate connectivity density as β1 / V

Author:
Michael Doube
See Also:

Toriwaki J, Yonekura T (2002) Euler Number and Connectivity Indexes of a Three Dimensional Digital Picture. Forma 17: 183-209. http://www.scipress.org/journals/forma/abstract/1703/17030183.html

Odgaard A, Gundersen HJG (1993) Quantification of connectivity in cancellous bone, with special emphasis on 3-D reconstructions. Bone 14: 173-182. doi:10.1016/8756-3282(93)90245-6

Lee TC, Kashyap RL, Chu CN (1994) Building Skeleton Models via 3-D Medial Surface Axis Thinning Algorithms. CVGIP: Graphical Models and Image Processing 56: 462-478. doi:10.1006/cgip.1994.1042

Several of the methods are based on Ignacio Arganda-Carreras's Skeletonize3D_ plugin: Skeletonize3D homepage

getOctant

private byte[] getOctant(ij.ImageStack stack,
                         int x,
                         int y,
                         int z)
Get octant of a vertex at (0,0,0) of a voxel (upper top left) in a 3D image (0 border conditions)

Parameters:
stack - 3D image (ImageStack)
x - x- coordinate
y - y- coordinate
z - z- coordinate (in image stacks the indexes start at 1)
Returns:
corresponding 8-pixel octant (0 if out of image)

getDeltaEuler

double getDeltaEuler(byte[] octant,
                     int[] LUT)
Get delta euler value for an octant (~= vertex) from look up table Only use this method when there is at least one foreground voxel in octant. In binary images, foreground is -1, background = 0

Parameters:
octant - 9 element array containing nVoxels in zeroth element and 8 voxel values
LUT - Euler LUT
Returns:
or false if the point is Euler invariant or not

getStackVertices

private int getStackVertices(ij.ImageStack stack)
Check all vertices of stack and count if foreground (-1) this is χ0 from Odgaard and Gundersen (1993) and f in my working

Parameters:
stack -
Returns:
number of voxel vertices intersecting with stack vertices

correctForEdges

private double correctForEdges(ij.ImageStack stack)

Calculate a correction value to convert the Euler number of a stack to the stack's contribution to the Euler number of whatever it is cut from.

  1. Number of voxel vertices on stack faces
  2. Number of voxel edges on stack faces
  3. Number of voxel faces on stack faces
  4. Number of voxel vertices on stack edges
  5. Number of voxel edges on stack edges
  6. Number of voxel vertices on stack vertices

Subtract the returned value from the Euler number prior to calculation of connectivity

Parameters:
stack -
Returns:
edgeCorrection for subtraction from the stack's Euler number

fillEulerLUT

private void fillEulerLUT(int[] LUT)
Fill Euler LUT Only odd indices are needed because we only check object voxels' neighbours, so there is always a 1 in each index. This is derived from Toriwaki & Yonekura (2002) Table 2 for 26-connected images.

Parameters:
LUT - Euler LUT
